Container.Name: GluetunVPN
Container.DonateText: This app and docker were generously made by qmcgaw. If you like the project please consider making a donation toward his efforts and check out the MANY other projects he has created on GitHub.
Container.Changes:
###3.25.0 ###Features - ExpressVPN Support (#623) - WeVPN Support (#591) - Healthcheck uses DNS and ping to github.com instead of only DNS to avoid relying on DNS cache - HEALTH_ADDRESS_TO_PING variable - Adapt logger prefix to VPN used - openvpn: for OpenVPN - wireguard: for Wireguard - VPNSP value custom for OpenVPN custom config files (#621) - VPNSP value custom for Wireguard custom configuration - WIREGUARD_PUBLIC_KEY variable - WIREGUARD_ENDPOINT_IP variable - OpenVPN custom configuration file is reloaded on VPN restarts - OpenVPN custom configuration file is parsed at start to log out valid settings - Support IPv6 routing for Wireguard - Log Wireguard server endpoint - Log Wireguard keys when LOG_LEVEL=debug - Windscribe OpenVPN default cipher set to aes-256-gcm - Update server information built-in - Cyberghost - FastestVPN - Mullvad - format-servers CLI command ###Fixes - Set non block on TUN device - Close HTTP client connections when tunnel comes up - Public IP loop deadlock - OpenVPN VPNSP=custom does not deduplicate lines - PureVPN remove OpenVPN cipher option AES-256-CBC - Cyberghost OpenVPN cipher option defaults to aes-128-gcm - Repository servers.json path for maintainer server update cli - Add missing HTTP status code check for Windscribe API - PIA_ENCRYPTION default in Go program - Defaults to strong instead of strong certificate string - No impact on Docker images since variable is set to strong in Dockerfile - Only read PIA_ENCRYPTION if service provider is PIA - (Security) Remove OpenVPN compression option (affects FastestVPN, Hide My Ass, IP Vanish, IVPN, NordVPN, PIA, PrivateVPN, ProtonVPN, Torguard, VPN Unlimited, VyprVPN) - FastestVPN updated OpenVPN configuration - HideMyAss: Cote d'Ivoire server country name - Log errors with error level for OpenVPN - PIA SERVER_NAME variable functionality
###3.24.0 ###Features - IVPN - Wireguard support (#584) - TCP protocol support for OpenVPN - Custom port support for OpenVPN - Servers data update (#578) - `ISP` filter (#578) - Mullvad - `WIREGUARD_PORT` support - Surfshark - Servers data improved (#575) - `LOG_LEVEL` variable (#577) - Add IP geolocation data to HTTP control server at `/v1/publicip/ip` - `OPENVPN_TARGET_IP` overrides IP for OpenVPN only - `WIREGUARD_ADDRESSES` accepts multiple comma separated IP networks ###Fixes - `FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS` IP rules - Wireguard - `FIREWALL_VPN_INPUT_PORTS` support - Fixed cleanup of wireguard link that was preventing restarts - Surfshark `REGION` retro-compatibility restored - `MULTIHOP_ONLY` defaults to `no` - Fix panic for certain 'no server found' errors - Clear IP data when VPN is stopped
###v3.23.0 - Support for Wireguard (IVPN, Mullvad and Windscribe) - Change ownership of OpenVPN configuration file with PUID and PGID - OpenVPN custom config process user gets removed - OpenVPN custom config with custom network interface name set properly in firewall - Sorted IP addresses for servers.json - Only allow traffic through VPN interface when needed - HTTP control server /v1/openvpn route interacts with OpenVPN settings only (not provider settings) - Image size lowered to 31MB - Using Alpine 3.14 - Wireguard support
###v3.22.0 - Allow multiple comma separated values for CYBERGHOST_GROUP - Update Cyberghost servers information - Change from SHADOWSOCKS_PORT to SHADOWSOCKS_LISTENING_ADDRESS - Windscribe: only use OpenVPN IP addresses, not Wireguard ones - Cyberghost: explicit-exit-notify used only for UDP, not TCP - Fix loop state change logic deadlock (preventing a 2nd restart for all run loops) - Use latest apk-tools to fix an Alpine vulnerability - Upgrade qdm12/ss-server to v0.3.0

Config.Name: TIMEZONE
Config.Description: Specify a timezone to use to have correct log times. i.e. Europe/London

Config.Name: config
Config.Description: Container Path: /gluetun

Config.Name: VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER
Config.Description: VPN Service Provider

Config.Name: VPN_TYPE
Config.Description: VPN Type. Default is OpenVPN

Config.Name: OPENVPN_PROTOCOL
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Container Variable: OPENVPN PROTOCOL

Config.Name: OPENVPN_USER
Config.Description: Container Variable: OPENVPN_USER

Config.Name: OPENVPN_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Container Variable: OPENVPN_PASSWORD

Config.Name: OPENVPN_VERSION
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Set the OpenVPN version to run

Config.Name: OPENVPN_VERBOSITY
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Openvpn verbosity level

Config.Name: OPENVPN_FLAGS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Space delimited openvpn flags to pass to openvpn

Config.Name: OPENVPN_CIPHER
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify a custom cipher to use. It will also set ncp-disable if using AES GCM for PIA. i.e. aes-256-gcm

Config.Name: OPENVPN_AUTH
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify a custom auth algorithm to use. i.e. sha256

Config.Name: OPENVPN_ROOT
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Run OpenVPN as root

Config.Name: OPENVPN_TARGET_IP
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify a target VPN IP address to use

Config.Name: OPENVPN_IPV6
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable tunneling of IPv6 (only for Mullvad)

Config.Name: OPENVPN_CUSTOM_CONFIG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: The path to your OpenVPN configuration file

Config.Name: OPENVPN_INTERFACE
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify a custom network interface name to use

Config.Name: PORT
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Custom VPN port to use. 80, 443 or 1401 for TCP; 53, 1194, 1195, 1196, 1197, 1300, 1301, 1302, 1303 or 1400 for UDP. Defaults to TCP 443 and UDP 1194

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_PRIVATE_KEY
Config.Description: 32 bytes key in base64 format. Wireguard private key, only required if VPN_TYPE=wireguard. Note this is usually specific by user and the same for all servers.

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_PRESHARED_KEY
Config.Description: 32 bytes key in base64 format. Optional Wireguard pre-shared key.

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_PUBLIC_KEY
Config.Description: Wireguard server public key

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_ADDRESS
Config.Description: Wireguard IP network in the format xx.xx.xx.xx/xx. Wireguard interface address, only required if VPN_TYPE=wireguard. Note this is usually specific by user and the same for all servers.

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_ENDPOINT_IP
Config.Description: Wireguard server endpoint IP address

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_ENDPOINT_PORT
Config.Description: 1 to 65535. Optional Wireguard custom server endpoint port

Config.Name: WIREGUARD_INTERFACE
Config.Description: Specify a custom network interface name to use

Config.Name: REGION
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN regions. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki/Servers-Readme

Config.Name: COUNTRY
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN countries. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki/Servers-Readme

Config.Name: CITY
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN cities. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki/Servers-Readme

Config.Name: SERVER_HOSTNAME
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of server hostnames. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki/Servers-Readme

Config.Name: FIREWALL
Config.Description: Turn on or off the container built-in firewall. You should turn off for debugging purposes only.

Config.Name: FIREWALL_VPN_INPUT_PORTS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of ports to allow from the VPN server side (useful for vyprvpn port forwarding)

Config.Name: FIREWALL_INPUT_PORTS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of ports to allow through the default interface. This seems needed for Unraid containers and Kubernetes sidecars.

Config.Name: FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: You first need to set your LAN CIDR in FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS. For example with FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS=192.168.1.0/24

Config.Name: FIREWALL_DEBUG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Prints every firewall related command. You should use it for debugging purposes only.

Config.Name: LOG_LEVEL
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Container Variable: LOG_LEVEL

Config.Name: HEALTH_SERVER_ADDRESS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Internal Health Server Listening Addroess

Config.Name: HEALTH_ADDRESS_TO_PING
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Address used to check tunnel health

Config.Name: HEALTH_VPN_DURATION_INITIAL
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Initial health check duration in seconds.

Config.Name: HEALTH_VPN_DURATION_ADDITION
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Subsequent health check duration in seconds.

Config.Name: DOT
Config.Description: (Recommended: on) Activate DNS over TLS with Unbound

Config.Name: DOT_PROVIDERS
Config.Description: Comma delimited list of DNS over TLS providers

Config.Name: DOT_PRIVATE_ADDRESS
Config.Description: All private CIDRs ranges. Comma separated list of CIDRs or single IP addresses Unbound won't resolve to. Note that the default setting prevents DNS rebinding

Config.Name: DOT_VERBOSITY
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Unbound verbosity level

Config.Name: DOT_VERBOSITY_DETAILS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Unbound details verbosity level

Config.Name: DOT_VALIDATION_LOGLEVEL
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Unbound validation log level

Config.Name: DOT_CACHING
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Unbound caching

Config.Name: DOT_IPV6
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: DNS IPv6 resolution

Config.Name: BLOCK_MALICIOUS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Block malicious hostnames and IPs with Unbound

Config.Name: BLOCK_SURVEILLANCE
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Block surveillance hostnames and IPs with Unbound

Config.Name: BLOCK_ADS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Block ads hostnames and IPs with Unbound

Config.Name: UNBLOCK
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of domain names to leave unblocked with Unbound. i.e. domain1.com,x.domain2.co.uk

Config.Name: DNS_UPDATE_PERIOD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Period to update block lists and cryptographic files and restart Unbound. Set to 0 to deactivate updates. i.e. 0, 30s, 5m, 24h

Config.Name: DNS_PLAINTEXT_ADDRESS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: IP address to use as DNS resolver if DOT is off

Config.Name: DNS_KEEP_NAMESERVER
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Keep the nameservers in /etc/resolv.conf untouched, but disabled DNS blocking features

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable the internal HTTP proxy

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_LOG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Logs every tunnel requests

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_PORT
Config.Description: Internal port number for the HTTP proxy to listen on

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_USER
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Username to use to connect to the HTTP proxy

Config.Name: HTTPPROXY_PASSWORD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Password to use to connect to the HTTP proxy

Config.Name: ENABLE_HTTPPROXY_STEALTH
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Stealth mode means HTTP proxy headers are not added to your requests

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable the internal Shadowsocks proxy

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_LOG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable Shadowsocks logging

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_PORT_TCP
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Internal TCP port number for the HTTP proxy to listen on

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_PORT_UDP
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Internal UDP port number for the HTTP proxy to listen on

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_PASSWORD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Password to use to connect to Shadowsocks

Config.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_CIPHER
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Cipher to use for Shadowsocks

Config.Name: UPDATER_PERIOD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Period to update all VPN servers information in memory and to /gluetun/servers.json. Set to 0 to disable. This does a burst of DNS over TLS requests, which may be blocked if you set BLOCK_MALICIOUS=on for example. Valid duration string such as 24h.

Config.Name: PUBLICIP_FILE
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Filepath to store the public IP address assigned

Config.Name: PUBLICIP_PERIOD
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Period to check for public IP address. Set to 0 to disable.

Config.Name: VERSION_INFORMATION
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Filepath to store the public IP address assigned

Config.Name: HTTP_CONTROL_SERVER_PORT
Config.Description: Container Port: 8000

Config.Name: HTTP_CONTROL_SERVER_LOG
Config.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable logging of HTTP requests

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: Container Variable: PUID

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: Container Variable: PGID
